intro: Hamelia intermedia, commonly known as flame bush, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has opposite, simple, and lance-shaped leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Hamelia intermedia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
